topic: “He couldn’t stand up so I hit him over the head with my bass. He fell to the floor. I ran away… I didn’t know if he was still alive”: The bassist who survived Fairport Convention, Jethro Tull and believing he’d murdered his bandmate on stage

ideas.title: The Espy Emergency
ideas.premise: A frazzled bassist is desperately explaining the incident to two very unimpressed ambos outside The Espy, while a banner inside reads "Fairport Convention Tribute Night".
ideas.why_funny: The juxtaposition of high drama and a daggy pub tribute gig is inherently Melburnian.

ideas.title: Myki Fail
ideas.premise: The bassist, drenched in sweat and bass in hand, is desperately trying to tap on a Myki at Flinders Street Station after fleeing the scene, but keeps getting 'insufficient funds'.
ideas.why_funny: Melbourne's public transport system is a universal source of frustration, adding to his panic.

ideas.title: The Arts Centre Aftermath
ideas.premise: A silhouette of the bassist running from the Hamer Hall is projected on the spire of the Arts Centre, accompanied by a chyron reading "Breaking News: Local Musician Fleeing Scene".
ideas.why_funny: The absurdity of the incident being treated as major breaking news in Melbourne.

ideas.title: Vegemite Surprise
ideas.premise: The 'victim' wakes up backstage, confused, with a giant Vegemite-shaped bump on his head, saying "Struth, I thought I was dreaming about winning the Archibald!"
ideas.why_funny: A quintessentially Australian recovery with a reference to famous portrait prize.

ideas.title: The Ian Anderson Apology Tour
ideas.premise: Ian Anderson (of Jethro Tull) is holding a press conference at the MCG, profusely apologising for the bassist's actions while wearing a cricket helmet.
ideas.why_funny: Ian Anderson taking responsibility for a random act of violence in a very public, unexpected location.
